Status.description: The status of the cluster. For example, 'available', 'updating' or 'creating'.

ClusterEndpoint.Address.description: The address of the cluster 's configuration endpoint.

ClusterEndpoint.Port.description: The port used by the cluster configuration endpoint.

ParameterGroupStatus.description: The status of the parameter group used by the cluster , for example `active` or `applying` .

ARN.description: When you pass the logical ID of this resource to the intrinsic `Ref` function, Ref returns the ARN of the cluster , such as `arn:aws:memorydb:us-east-1:123456789012:cluster/my-cluster`

Address.description: The DNS hostname of the node.

Port.description: The port number that the engine is listening on.

Endpoint.description: Represents the information required for client programs to connect to the cluster and its nodes.

description: Specifies a cluster . All nodes in the cluster run the same protocol-compliant engine software.

ACLName.description: The name of the Access Control List to associate with the cluster .

AutoMinorVersionUpgrade.description: When set to true, the cluster will automatically receive minor engine version upgrades after launch.

DataTiering.description: Enables data tiering. Data tiering is only supported for clusters using the r6gd node type. This parameter must be set when using r6gd nodes. For more information, see [Data tiering](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/memorydb/latest/devguide/data-tiering.html) .

Engine.description: The name of the engine used by the cluster.

EngineVersion.description: The Redis engine version used by the cluster .

FinalSnapshotName.description: The user-supplied name of a final cluster snapshot. This is the unique name that identifies the snapshot. MemoryDB creates the snapshot, and then deletes the cluster immediately afterward.

KmsKeyId.description: The ID of the KMS key used to encrypt the cluster .

MaintenanceWindow.description:
Specifies the weekly time range during which maintenance on the cluster is performed. It is specified as a range in the format `ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi` (24H Clock UTC). The minimum maintenance window is a 60 minute period.

*Pattern* : `ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi`

MultiRegionClusterName.description: The name of the multi-Region cluster that this cluster belongs to.

NumReplicasPerShard.description:
The number of replicas to apply to each shard.

*Default value* : `1`

*Maximum value* : `5`

NumShards.description: The number of shards in the cluster .

ParameterGroupName.description: The name of the parameter group used by the cluster .

Port.description: The port used by the cluster .

SecurityGroupIds.description: A list of security group names to associate with this cluster .

SnapshotArns.description: A list of Amazon Resource Names (ARN) that uniquely identify the RDB snapshot files stored in Amazon S3. The snapshot files are used to populate the new cluster . The Amazon S3 object name in the ARN cannot contain any commas.

SnapshotName.description: The name of a snapshot from which to restore data into the new cluster . The snapshot status changes to restoring while the new cluster is being created.

SnapshotRetentionLimit.description: The number of days for which MemoryDB retains automatic snapshots before deleting them. For example, if you set SnapshotRetentionLimit to 5, a snapshot that was taken today is retained for 5 days before being deleted.

SnapshotWindow.description: The daily time range (in UTC) during which MemoryDB begins taking a daily snapshot of your shard. Example: 05:00-09:00 If you do not specify this parameter, MemoryDB automatically chooses an appropriate time range.

SnsTopicArn.description: When you pass the logical ID of this resource to the intrinsic `Ref` function, Ref returns the ARN of the SNS topic, such as `arn:aws:memorydb:us-east-1:123456789012:mySNSTopic`

SnsTopicStatus.description: The SNS topic must be in Active status to receive notifications.

SubnetGroupName.description: The name of the subnet group used by the cluster .

TLSEnabled.description: A flag to indicate if In-transit encryption is enabled.

Tags.description:
An array of key-value pairs to apply to this resource.

For more information, see [Tag](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/aws-properties-resource-tags.html) .
